repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Second Emergency
            Municipal Services Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Emergency
            Municipal Services Rehabilitation Project (EMSRP II) for
            West Bank and Gaza (WBG) were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was substantial;
            Bank performance was satisfactory; and borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            similar emergency initiatives would clearly benefit from
            performing Beneficiary Impact Assessments (BIAs) at key
            points during the project (e.g. early on after
            effectiveness, mid-term and closing) to help focus and steer
            the project and draw out lessons learned particularly when
            the baseline data are inadequate. Attractive as they may be
            it is not a good idea to include pilots in emergency
            projects unless they are clearly related to the emergency at
            hand or some very important allied project objective, and
            also have strong local ownership. The view of this
            Implementation Completion Report (ICR) is that they should
            be included only when the potential learning payoffs are
            highly relevant to the emergency in question. Otherwise,
            they are likely to be treated as a distraction which is
            partly the case under the EMSRP II. An unplanned and
            unheralded achievement in Gaza was the adaptation of
            existing machinery and equipment (tractors, etc.) for
            critical infrastructure and service delivery tasks when the
            import of materials and spare parts was severely restricted
            by Israeli blockades. Local Bank staff recognized the local
            need and potential and provided support accordingly to local
            engineers and mechanics. While not explicitly stated in
            project documents, EMSRP II was in fact part of an evolution
            of municipal sector institution building in WBG a shifting
            from individual project funding to a much broader, more
            equitable, more transparent, and more sustainable
            programmatic approach as witnessed by the successor
            Municipal Development Project (MDP). However, the reform
            process has taken 8-10 years and it has required much
            nurturing by successive and committed on-ground Bank teams.

15590441.trustfund:
TF057873-SECOND EMERGENCY MUNICIPAL
            SERVICES REHABILITATION PROJECT,TF071367-Second Emergency Municipal
            Rehabilitation Project (EMSRPII),TF092840-SWEDISH TRUST FUND FOR EMSRP II,TF094522-Additional Financing for the
            Emergency Municipal Services Rehabilitatio,TF096990-Emergency Municipal Service
            Rehabilitation II Project

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Second Emergency
            Municipal Services Rehabilitation Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of Second Emergency
            Municipal Services Rehabilitation Project for West Bank and
            Gaza are to: (a) provide funding for infrastructure
            rehabilitation and maintenance to help mitigate further
            deterioration in the delivery of essential municipal
            services; and (b) create temporary job opportunities at the
            local level through the launching of labor-intensive
            employment generation schemes. The closing date for the
            project will be extended from June 30, 2011 to September 30,
            2011. The reasons for the extension are as follows: (i)
            there was a 6 month delay in the signing of the Grant
            Agreement, the signing of the Administration Agreement with
            Denmark on December 10, 2009; (ii) all preparation
            activities were completed on the assumption of a January
            2010 start date. However, the delay in signing the Grant
            Agreement, coupled with the fluctuations in the Gaza Strip
            market, meant that several of the activities had to be
            re-done, resulting in a further delay in sub-project
            implementation. This will be the second extension of the
            project but the first extension of the Trust Fund.

display_title.display_title:
West Bank and Gaza - Second
            Emergency Municipal Services Rehabilitation Project :
            restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

10907544.trustfund:
TF094522-Additional Financing for the
            Emergency Municipal Services Rehabilitatio

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Replenishment of the
            Trust Fund for Gaza and West Bank and the Gaza Emergency
            Response Additional Finance Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The project relates to six ongoing
            operations and is processed under the operational policy,
            rapid responses to crisis, and emergencies. The six
            operations are: Electric Utility Management Project, Third
            Emergency Services Support Project, Second Gaza Emergency
            Water Project, Second Emergency Municipal Services
            Rehabilitation Project, Third Palestinian Non-Governmental
            Organization (NGO) Project, and Tertiary Education Project.
            The Electric Utility Management Project will carry out the
            urgent restoration of the damaged network, specifically, for
            procurement of essential distribution equipment for Gaza
            Electric Distribution Company (GEDCO) to replace damages and
            restore the Gaza distribution network to ensure it operates
            in a technically stable manner. The Third Emergency Services
            Support Project will mainly fund operating costs for
            Ministries of Education, higher education, health, and
            social affairs but also recurrent expenditures to ensure the
            public facilities can remain operational. The Second Gaza
            Emergency Water Project will finance the rehabilitation of
            the damaged water works and equipment as a result of the
            recent escalation of conflict in Gaza. The Second Emergency
            Municipal Services Rehabilitation Project will finance
            emergency municipal services assistance grants,
            labor-intensive employment generation activities, and
            project management costs. The Third Palestinian
            Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) Project will support NGO
            grants for service delivery, given its ability to address
            the direct needs of the population towards recovery. The
            Tertiary Education Project will help to increase the finance
            of the ongoing Quality Improvement Fund (QIF) aimed to
            provide support to improve the quality of Palestinian
            tertiary education institutions and programs.

docna.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Replenishment of the
            Trust Fund for Gaza and West Bank and the Gaza Emergency
            Response Additional Finance Program

display_title.display_title:
West Bank and Gaza -
            Replenishment of the Trust Fund for Gaza and West Bank and
            the Gaza Emergency Response Additional Finance Program
